title.narrative: Centrul Media / Enhancing journalists?s capacity in reflecting human rights and gender equality issues
Centrul Media / Toimittajien kapasiteetin kasvatus ihmisoikeus- ja tasa-arvoteemoissa

description.narrative: This project aims at enhancing the capacity of the media outlets and journalists in approaching and properly addressing Human Rights issues in their daily work also an assessment of the situation with HR issues (including the rights of women and girls) bei ng reflected in the media.The project includes Russian speaking journalists Moldova including its Russian speaking regions Transnistria and Gagauzia. Most of the media outlets used in these regions are of Russian origin with challenges with freedom of expr ession and fact based journalism. In Transnistria isolating the population and media from Moldovan information sources is also a matter of politics. So accessing a training in HR in their language of use for both groups is a challenge. Also treating HR sub jects for all of them is of a subsequent difficulty because of each region?s situation and a general lack of democracy and HR culture. By enhancing the capacity of media outlets and journalists to treat Human Rights issues we are enabling the whole society in dealing with Human Rights violation and have the freedom of speech improved.The project expected outputs include: 1)Baseline assessment of regional journalists needs in matter of human rights and gender equality;2)A two days project kick-off event for selected 15 regional journalists3)A course of 10 online training webinars for 15 journalists about human rights based approach and gender equality mainstreaming into mass-media4)8 monthly online meetings and thematic webinars for journalists5)A 12 months individual mentorship program for 15-20 regional journalists6)Minimum of 45 articles and video reportages integrating the HRBA and gender equality perspective produced by the regional journalists reaching at least 300 000 people. 7)An assessment report on the HRBA gender equality and UN SDGs in selected regional media outlets in 2021 and 2022 in Moldova8)An impact analysis report to evaluate how the project materials have changed the situationThe project beneficiaries are 15 Russian speaking journalists and their media outlets coming from different parts of Moldova (including Transnistria and Gagauzia). Secondary beneficiary is the wider public who consumes the medias.The project is to be implemented by a local NGO in Transnistria Centrul Media in partnershi p with a national NGO registered in Chisinau HomoDiversus.The FLC grant for the project is 50 000 EUR.
